passage:
(1) Earth has different climate zones. Some places are hot, some are cold, and others are mild. The climate of a place depends on how close it is to the equator, how high it is above sea level, and how near it is to an ocean. Climate affects the plants and animals that can live in each area. It also affects how people live their lives.

(2) Hot climate zones are near the equator. In these places, it is warm all year. Many tropical rainforests are in hot zones. People who live in hot climates often have houses with good air flow to stay cool. They may wear light clothes and eat foods that grow well in warm weather. Some hot places get a lot of rain, while others are very dry.

(3) Cold climate zones are near the North and South Poles. These areas have long, cold winters and short, cool summers. Not many plants can grow in cold climates because of the low temperatures. People in cold areas need warm clothes and houses with good heating. They often eat foods that can be stored for a long time. Many cold places have snow for several months each year.

(4) Mild climate zones are between hot and cold zones. These areas have four seasons: spring, summer, fall, and winter. The temperature changes throughout the year, but it is rarely extremely hot or cold. Many different types of plants and animals can live in mild climates. People in these areas often change their activities based on the season. They may swim in summer and ski in winter.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
Choose the correct past tense form: 'Yesterday, I ___ to the store.'
Select the correct preposition: 'The book is ___ the table.'
Which is the correct question form?

options.A: What time you go to bed?
options.B: What time go you to bed?
options.C: What time do you go to bed?
options.D: What time does you go to bed?

questions.question: Choose the correct article: 'I saw ___ elephant at the zoo.'
Which sentence uses the correct plural form?
Select the correct comparative form: 'This box is ___ than that one.'
Choose the correct possessive form: 'That is ___ house.'
Which sentence is in the present continuous tense?

options.A: She walks to school every day.
options.C: She is walking to school now.
options.D: She will walk to school tomorrow.

questions.question: Choose the correct modal verb: 'You ___ brush your teeth twice a day.'
Select the correct future form: 'I ___ my grandmother next weekend.'
Which sentence has the correct word order?

options.A: Often they go to the beach in summer.
options.B: They often go to the beach in summer.
options.C: They go often to the beach in summer.
options.D: They go to the beach often in summer.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'There ___ a book on the desk.'
Which sentence uses 'too' correctly?

options.A: The soup is too hot for drink.
options.B: The soup is too hot to drinking.
options.C: The soup is too hot to drink.
options.D: The soup is hot too to drink.

options.C: the condition that separates living things from non-living things

options.C: to grab and hold something moving

options.A: Can you come to my house tomorrow?

options.C: She draws to school every day.

questions.question: What does 'dark' mean in this sentence? 'It gets dark early in winter.'
According to paragraph 1, what determines the climate of a place?

options.A: Only its distance from the equator
options.B: The types of plants that grow there
options.D: Its location relative to the equator, sea level, and oceans

questions.question: Based on the passage, which of these is TRUE about hot climate zones?

options.A: They are located near the poles.
options.C: They are located near the equator.

questions.question: According to paragraph 2, people in hot climates often have houses with:
The passage states that cold climate zones are located:

options.C: near the North and South Poles

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what do people in cold areas need?
What does the passage say about plants in cold climates?

options.A: Many different types can grow there.
options.C: Not many can grow there because of low temperatures.
options.D: They are the same as plants in hot climates.

questions.question: Based on the passage, mild climate zones have:
According to paragraph 4, people in mild climate zones:

options.B: change their activities based on the season
options.D: move to different places each season

questions.question: The word 'affect' in paragraph 1 is closest in meaning to:
What is the main purpose of this passage?

options.A: To explain how climate affects plant growth
options.B: To compare houses in different regions
options.C: To describe different climate zones on Earth
options.D: To explain why people move to different climate zones
